column1: Important COVID-19 reminder as we get closer to Thanksgiving 👇 https://t.co/pDurzRLsnZ

COVID-19 cases are again on the rise & for the doctors nurses and healthcare workers at NYC hospitals “it’s kind of like waiting for a bomb to go off.”   NYC: We can't just cheer for these workers we have to do our part to keep them safe too. https://t.co/JBy4xAjOI5

When Congressional Republicans ignore COVID-19 guidelines they don't just put themselves at risk. 153 frontline Capitol workers have contracted the virus & it's on all of us elected to office to lead by example wear a mask & keep those around us safe. https://t.co/nlxcaxDJMa

Help keep our communities safe by wearing a mask social distancing and getting tested for COVID-19! You can find your nearest Queens testing site here or by going to https://t.co/tqBmIVxHnk https://t.co/xiOll8bKQP

With @realDonaldTrump NYC is an "anarchist jurisdiction."  With @JoeBiden NYC could get much-needed coronavirus relief for families protect immigrant communities see real federal investment in transportation & have an ally in the White House again: https://t.co/1qypjNAwai

Thank you to the voters for once again selecting me to be their voice in Washington! I remain committed to combating COVID-19 & getting our economy back on track & will continue working to pave the way for a better future for Queens working families and all families every day.

.@senatemajldr can’t lift his finger to pass bills to help Americans hurt by coronavirus pandemic but gave everything he got to confirm someone who could take away healthcare access from millions of Americans. #AmyConeyBarrettSCOTUS

Without the ACA more than 20M will lose their coverage & more than 135M including COVID-19 survivors will lose protections for preexisting conditions.   Healthcare is on the ballot & we all can vote to protect it. Go to https://t.co/LCt1Zkav0q today. https://t.co/3fxsRqes7F
I don’t really care how he got #coronavirus. I care that he knew he had it and didn’t do everything in his power to protect others...since day 1.

There are 70000 NYers struggling with long-term symptoms of COVID-19 & that number is growing every day. This disease can be devastating in ways we don't yet understand which means it's that much more important to do our part to prevent its spread. https://t.co/KhtWqLMm81

A reminder to @realDonaldTrump ahead of tonight's convention. "Coronavirus" or "COVID-19" are both good names for the virus. "Chinese virus" is not.  Stop encouraging hate and stop putting AAPIs in danger.

These lifesaving supplies shouldn’t be secured on a piecemeal basis. It’s hard enough to get kids to social distance as it is.
